name: Upper Cliffs
role_in_state: strategic lookout and niche maritime supplier
economy_niches: high-grade rope, tackle and rigging workshops
ritual augury services tied to lookout stations
culture_adjustments: lookout-clan kinship often outranks harbor-clan ties
tide-and-wind festivals include cliff-edge rites and wind-offerings
dialect peppered with lookout-specific nautical vocabulary
strong salvage-rights customs and thrift-driven salvage economy
height-taboo burial and rescue practices distinct from lowlands
constraints: steep, single-track coastal roads hinder heavy trade
ritual magic reliant on imported reagents â€” supply-vulnerable
notes: visual lookout chain integrated with state navigational auguries
key exports: salt, rope/rigging, dried fish, augury readings
local ordinances restrict large-scale shipyards to protect ledges
